content.full_text:
FWO DMP Template Project supervisors (from applica3on round 2018 onwards) and fellows (from applica3on round 2020 onwards) will, upon being awarded their project or fellowship, be invited to develop their answers to the data management related ques3ons into a DMP . The FWO expects a completed DMP no later than 6 months a3er the oﬃcial start date of the project or fellowship. The DMP should not be submiIed to FWO but to the research co-ordina3on oﬃce of the host ins3tute; FWO may request the DMP in a random check.  At the end of the project, the ﬁnal version of the DMP has to be added to the ﬁnal report of the project; this should be submiIed to FWO by the supervisor-spokesperson through FWO’s e-portal. This DMP may of course have been updated since its ﬁrst version. The DMP is an element in the ﬁnal evalua3on of the project by the relevant expert panel. Both the DMP submiIed within the ﬁrst 6 months aTer the start date and the ﬁnal DMP may use this template. 1.General Informa=on Name applicant Denis CarnierFWO Project Number & TitleRigorous Veriﬁca=on of Trusted and Conﬁden=al Compu=ng in Embedded SeGngs (1S46525N)Aﬃlia3on☐ KU Leuven 2.Data descrip=on Will you generate/collect new data and/or make use of exis3ng data? ☐ Generate new data: Not really, see below ☐ Reuse exis3ng data: No
2019-10-01 | FWO DMP Template   1
Describe the origin, type and format of the data (per dataset) and its (es3mated) volume If you reuse exis+ng data, specify the source of these data.  Dis+nguish data types (the kind of content) from data formats (the technical format).We will generate: - Mathema=cal proofs, - So3ware code, - Proof code.3.Ethical and legal issues Will you use personal data? If so, shortly describe the kind of personal data you will use AND add the reference to your ﬁle in your host ins3tu3on's privacy register. In case your host ins+tu+on does not (yet) have a privacy register, a reference is not yet required of course; please add the reference once the privacy register is in place in your host ins+tu+on.☐ No If yes:  -Privacy Registry Reference: -Short descrip3on of the kind of personal data that will be used:Are there any ethical issues concerning the crea3on and/or use of the data (e.g. experiments on humans or animals, dual use)? If so, add the reference to the formal approval by the relevant ethical review commiIee(s).☐ No If yes:  -Reference to ethical commiIee approval: Does your work possibly result in research data with poten3al for tech transfer and valorisa3on? Will IP restric3ons be claimed for the data you created? If so, for what data and which restric3ons will be asserted?☐ No If yes, please comment:2019-10-01 | FWO DMP Template   2
Do exis3ng 3rd party agreements restrict dissemina3on or exploita3on of the data you (re)use? If so, to what data do they relate and what restric3ons are in place?☐ No If yes, please comment: 4.Documenta=on and metadata What documenta3on will be provided to enable understanding and reuse of the data collected/generated in this project? - The mathema=cal proofs should be readable by themselves to experts - So3ware and proof code should be documented as is standard prac=ce for such materials, and will typically be associated to a publica=on which further explains the purpose and design.Will a metadata standard be used? If so, describe in detail which standard will be used.  If not, state in detail which metadata will be created to make the data easy/easier to ﬁnd and reuse.☐ N/A If yes, please specify:5.Data storage & backup during the FWO project Where will the data be stored? So3ware and proof code and mathema=cal proofs, as well as scien=ﬁc wri=ng: wri[en on my work laptop and several =mes daily pushed to a remote git repository; typically github.com, butbucket.com or dnetcode.cs.kuleuven.be (“DistriNet Code is the so3ware project management tool of DistriNet.”). We could also move to gitlab.kuleuven.be.How will the data be backed up? Crea3ng back-ups of source code and manuscripts is an integral part of the use of online code repositories and hence en3rely implicit.2019-10-01 | FWO DMP Template   3
Is there currently suﬃcient storage & backup capacity during the project? If yes, specify concisely. If no or insuﬃcient storage or backup capaci3es are available, then explain how this will be taken care of. ☐ Yes: the source ﬁles are plain text ﬁles which add up to an order of MBs or one or two GBs at worst. If no, please specify: What are the expected costs for data storage and backup during the project? How will these costs be covered?  Although FWO has no earmarked budget at its disposal to support correct research data management, FWO allows for part of the allocated project budget to be used to cover the cost incurred.Given the small total size of the data, this cost is negligible.
Data security: how will you ensure that the data are securely stored and not accessed or modiﬁed by unauthorized persons? - The researcher's personal devices are password-protected, - Access to code repositories is protected by password or ssh-key, - Data is not par=cularly sensi=ve as the project does not involve personal data, - We are in favour of open access and even crea=ve commons publica=ons and the ﬁeld has a suﬃciently coopera=ve spirit that even publicly accessible WIP is feasible, so access by unauthorized persons is not really an issue to begin with.6.Data preserva=on a3er the end of the FWO project FWO expects that data generated during the project are retained for a period of minimally 5 years aTer the end of the project, in as far as legal and contractual agreements allow. 
2019-10-01 | FWO DMP Template   4
Which data will be retained for the expected 5 year period aTer the end of the project? In case only a selec3on of the data can/will be preserved, clearly state the reasons  for this (legal or contractual restric3ons, physical preserva3on issues, ...).So3ware and proof code will be stored on a git repository (such as github.com). Mathema=cal proofs will become an integral part of scien=ﬁc publica=ons; either way they will be deposited in Lirias.Where will these data be archived (= stored for the long term)? Same as for the ﬁrst 5 years.What are the expected costs for data preserva3on during these 5 years? How will the costs be covered?  Although FWO has no earmarked budget at its disposal to support correct research data management, FWO allows for part of the allocated project budget to be used to cover the cost incurred.Services as github.com and the ArXiv are currently free, whereas Lirias and gitlab.kuleuven.be are oﬀered by KU Leuven. Given the small total size of the data, the worst case costs will s=ll be very low.7.Data sharing and reuse Are there any factors restric3ng or preven3ng the sharing of (some of) the data (e.g. as deﬁned in an agreement with a 3rd party, legal restric3ons)? ☐ No If yes, please specify:Which data will be made available aTer the end of the project? See above.2019-10-01 | FWO DMP Template   5
Where/how will the data be made available for reuse? ☐ In an Open Access repository ☐ Other (specify): See above When will the data be made available? At publica=on =me at the latest.Who will be able to access the data and under what condi3ons? There are no reasons to restrict these data, which are not sensi=ve. They will be publicly available.What are the expected costs for data sharing? How will these costs be covered?  Although FWO has no earmarked budget at its disposal to support correct research data management, FWO allows for part of the allocated project budget to be used to cover the cost incurred.See above.
2019-10-01 | FWO DMP Template   6
